name: Theater BA
overview: The Theater BA provides students with a liberal arts education by combining critical study of theater and performance with experiential practice in one or more of its component parts. Students explore acting, design, directing, formal and textual analysis, playwriting, and production to build a foundation for future creative work. The Theater major is a designated capstone major where students demonstrate general knowledge and specialized skills through independent scholarship and/or a high degree of artistic achievement in each of the undergraduate areas.
college: School of Theater, Film, and Television

sections.title: Preparation for the Major
sections.description: Complete the following six required courses and 4 units of Theater 50.

sections.title: The Major
sections.description: Complete two required courses, one capstone seminar, one elective, and 34 upper-division theater elective units as follows:

requirements.title: History/Literature/Criticism Elective
requirements.description: Select one course from Theater 102A through 113.

requirements.title: Additional Electives
requirements.description: Complete 34 upper-division theater elective units. Up to 8 units of upper-division credit in the Department of Film, Television, and Digital Media may be included in the 34-unit theater elective requirement.

requirements.title: Emphases (Optional)
requirements.description: Majors wishing to pursue one of the emphases in the areas of acting, design and production, directing, musical theater, or playwriting are expected to complete a number of regularly offered elective courses.
